title: I feel like League is seriously lacking victorian/old english and fictional gothic aesthetics
body:
Meanwhile we have like hundreds of asian skins and many asian champions. The only champions I could think of that somehow represent the said patterns are Nosferatu/Marquis Vladimir, Vayne's Aristocrat skin and small bits of Caitlyn's design (tell me if I'm wrong, but I really can't remember anyone else. Ah, humorous gentlemen skins actually count?). I'm definitely **not** talking about steampunk, but the other fictional representations of 1800-1900 years. You know, like Bram Stoker's Dracula (so the fictional Transylvania in media), Frankenstein, many species of english serial killers like Jack the Ripper **(Who wouldn't want to have Dr. Mundo wearing a top hat?)**, Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes and many other fine pieces dedicated to that era. This thought actually came to my mind after playing Bloodborne, which, I must say, has the best design decisions I have ever seen in games (at least for me). 
Sometimes I really feel an urge to play as someone classy (in the true meaning of that word) without having to turn off the League. Thanks for reading.
http://orig00.deviantart.net/de42/f/2012/342/c/9/jack_the_ripper_by_davepalumbo-d5nf3d2.jpg

Oooh! Haha >xD

I'd really like to work on Champion Update some day. They have a really challenging job; balancing skins and champion team's requirements with a functionally smaller team. They have to retain the core of what players love about champions while also bringing something unique and competitive to their gameplay. I love challenges and have been playing since 2010 so I feel like I could do some great work there. Until then, skins!

Thanks for your support all this time, it means the world to me.

Nah man, after the Soraka Visual Update Fanart you did i can't not keeping an eye to you, it was amazing and i know for a fact everything you make for a new champion or a updated one will look amazing.

Spring Heeled Jhin
:O

It would be perfect for a Pilty

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/srDwbZk-tJE/maxresdefault.jpg

Piltover has only slight Steam Punk aesthetics scattered about. They like gears and what not, but that's about as far as it goes. Going off champions, they don't appear to distinctly steam punk, but do draw some inspiration here and there.

{{champion:51}}'s rifle and outfit seem to be victorian/steam punk inspired. But it's only very slight.
{{champion:42}} Has nothing really. He's more junkyard mechanic than anything.
{{champion:81}} Has more of a rough mage appearance.
{{champion:74}} Old donger had brass turrets which could pass. They're more modern now.
{{champion:126}} Like Cait, his weapon and clothes seem to draw inspiration but more exagerated.
{{champion:61}} Has a very clear steam punk inspirations in her design.
{{champion:254}} Her outfit, maybe. Though her theme is more rough and rugged future than anything.
{{champion:115}} Nothing at all. He's just a bomber.

Overall the Victorian Steam Punk kinda aesthetic is just scattered about, it's not laid on too heavy. You can very clearly see where they have drawn some inspiration. But Piltover seems to only like it. Even then you have Future Tech aesthetics here and there as well. If they leaned more heavily on Steam/Victorian they'd probably ruin it.
we have so many asian characters because riot knows their weeb audience and also its mega popular in east asia

I would love a victorian Jhin skin complete with top hat and suit.

I'd love to have vampire warrior champion who's abilities are directly based upon the vampiric powers from books and legends (besides Twilight books).
ahaha his joke can be "ahhh the sun...wait why arent i glowing?"

{{champion:421}}
Ao Shin?

I think the reason that we have a lot or too many Asian theme skin is because we actually have an event that revolve around it, but that doesn't mean we can't have an annual skin type to be release without it being tied to an event. 

These skin could be like be what you and all of us want. Although it wouldn't be all Victorian era esq things it could maybe one year be purely Victorian the next more Steam punk and the year after that it could be Noir because even though we get Asian skin they are not the same every year I mean yes they are all Asian theme but they are not exactly the same. 

Although I did say it don't have to be an event thing it still be cool to give it a name as to generalize it like for Valentine we get heart and suit if every year we get something like Victorian, steam punk, noir, or gothic what can we call it?

Also I would love a Mr. Hyde Mundo 
http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/villains/images/3/30/Mr._Hyde.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110304200338
http://ndla.no/sites/default/files/images/F5692.jpg
It's an aesthetic that would really fit nicely for some elements of Piltover and Zaun, or even Demacia and Noxus to a lesser extent. I wouldn't mind seeing it show up a bit more.
